      </span>

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:758px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox21771322">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771322">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771322">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Scholarly Books
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21771322">
          <div id="boxatt21771322" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25254011">
              <a id="link_25254011" href="https://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/advancedsearch" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254011,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 25254011}); ">
               Encompass Search (Advanced Search)
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Encompass Search finds information by searching through a massive collection of books, as well as scholarly journals, newspapers and magazines, dissertations, conference proceedings, music, video, maps, and more. TO FIND ONLY BOOKS, use the Books limit on the left sidebar of your search results page. Many items will be in Trexler Library; note the call number and status of the item to check its location and availability. For items not in Trexler Library, use the Interlibrary Loan button to request a copy from another library.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254012">
              <a id="link_25254012" href="https://books.google.com/" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254012,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 25254012}); ">
               Google Books
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Search a broad selection of books. Access full text of books directly or get a preview before requesting the book from another library using Interlibrary Loan via Encompass Search.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21771323">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771323">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771323">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Scholarly Journal Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21771323">
          <div id="boxatt21771323" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25254014">
              <a id="link_25254014" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=31h" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254014,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 25254014}); ">
               America: History and Life with Full Text
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Premier database of scholarly journals and books in US history and related areas. Some full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise, use the Get It links to check for full text online or in the library.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254013">
              <a id="link_25254013" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=ufh" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254013,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12600190}); ">
               Communication and Mass Media Complete
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               Premier database of scholarly and trade journals and books in media and communication and related areas. Some full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise, use the Check for Full Text buttons to check for full text online or in the library.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254015">
              <a id="link_25254015" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=web&amp;defaultdb=f3h" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254015,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 19008881}); ">
               Film and Television Literature Index with Full Text
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of scholarly journals, trade journals, books, and more in the areas of television and film.  Most full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise use the Check for Full Text buttons to check for full text online or in the library.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25276378">
              <a id="link_25276378" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=30h" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25276378,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12706339}); ">
               Historical Abstracts with Full Text
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of scholarly journal articles, books, book chapter, book reviews, dissertations, and more for world history (excluding U.S. and Canada). Some full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise use the Check for Full Text buttons to check for full text online or in the library.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254022">
              <a id="link_25254022" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.jstor.org/" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254022,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12364481}); ">
               JSTOR
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of scholarly journals for most academic disciplines. The most recent three to five years of most journals are not included.  Full text is linked directly in the database.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254019">
              <a id="link_25254019" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=web&amp;defaultdb=mzh" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254019,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 14068736}); ">
               MLA International Bibliography
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of scholarly journals and books in literature, language, linguistics, film studies, and folklore.  Use the Check for Full Text buttons to check for full text online or in the library.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254023">
              <a id="link_25254023" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=https://muse.jhu.edu/browse" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254023,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 14068693}); ">
               Project MUSE
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of scholarly journals for the the arts, humanities, and social sciences.  Full text is linked directly in the database.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21771324">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771324">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771324">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Popular (News and Magazine) Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content21771324">
          <div id="boxatt21771324" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
             <li id="link25254016">
              <a id="link_25254016" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=a9h" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254016,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12335038}); ">
               Academic Search Complete
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of both scholarly and popular publications in a wide variety of disciplines and subject areas. TO LIMIT TO POPULAR SOURCES, choose NEWSPAPERS and/or MAGAZINES on the left sidebar of a search results page under source types. Most full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise use the Get It links to check for full text online or in the library. Generally covers 1980s to present.
              </div>
             </li>
             <li id="link25254017">
              <a id="link_25254017" href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.lexisnexis.com/hottopics/lnacademic" target="_blank" onclick="hit(25254017,'links','1', {'link_obj' : this, 'guide_name' : 'Cross-Gender Performance in Media Culture ', 'page_name' : 'Home'}); return SpringTrack.trackLink(this, {st_type : TRACKING_TYPE_LINK, link_id: 12369574}); ">
               LexisNexis Academic
              </a>
              <div class="linkdesc">
               A database of newspapers, magazines, broadcast transcripts, business publications, legal materials, and more. Full text is linked directly in the database. Generally covers 1980s to the present.
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21771325">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771325">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771325">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Getting the Full Text of Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content10536644">
          <p>
           To get the full text of an article, consider the following options:
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you are in Encompass Search or a library database, look for "Check for Full Text buttons," "Access Online," or "Check eResources" buttons. These buttons will take you the full text of the article or tell you that the full text cannot be found. If the full text is not available from Trexler Library, look for buttons to request the item from another library via interlibrary loan. Or go directly to the
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           request forms.
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you have citation information for the article (i.e., journal title, article title, publication year, etc.), type the information about your article in
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           on the library website. If the library subscribes to the full text, you will be directed to the article (see first bullet above). If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           - If Trexler Library does not have access to the full text of the article, search
           <a href="http://www.google.com/scholar">
            Google Scholar
           </a>
           by article title to see if the author has made a copy freely available online. If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt10536644" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21771326">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771326">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771326">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Following Citation Trails
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content21771326">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Track Back
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Once you find a good source, scan the citations in the bibliographies to see what sources the author(s) are citing. They are likely citing some other (older) books, articles, etc. relevant to your topic. To do this...
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Browse the bibliography at the end of your article, chapter, or book.
            </li>
            <li>
             If you discover a citation in the bibliography that looks promising, type the article title or book title in
             <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
              Encompass Search
             </a>
             on the library homepage to locate the source in our library or to request a copy from another library using interlibrary loan (ILL).
            </li>
           </ul>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Track Forward
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Once you find a good source, it may be helpful to look for other books and articles that cite the source in their bibliographies. A more recently published book or article using your good source could also be relevant to your topic. To do this...
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Path 1
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Check the database where you discovered the source for a "Times Cited in this Database" link.
            </li>
            <li>
             Click the link to see the more recently published sources citing your source in the database you're using.
            </li>
            <li>
             If you discover a citation that looks promising, you may be able to get the full text in the database or by using the
             <strong>
              Check for Full Text
             </strong>
             <span>
              &nbsp;buttons
             </span>
             &nbsp;to look for full text in other library databases. If no full text is available, request a copy from another library using interlibrary loan (ILL).
            </li>
           </ul>
          </blockquote>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Path 2
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Type the article title, book title, or book chapter tile in
             <a href="https://scholar.google.com/">
              Google Scholar
             </a>
             .
            </li>
            <li>
             Look for the "Cited by" link just below the description of the source.
            </li>
            <li>
             Click the link to see the more recently published sources citing your source.
            </li>
            <li>
             If you discover a citation that looks promising, you may be able to get the full text by clicking the link in Google Scholar. If the full text isn't available (e.g., no link or you're prompted to log in or pay), type the article title or book title in
             <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
              Encompass Search
             </a>
             on the library homepage to locate the source in our library or to request a copy from another library using interlibrary loan (ILL).
            </li>
           </ul>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt21771326" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox21771327">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771327">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771327">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Citing Your Sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content21771327">
          <p>
           <strong>
            APA, Chicago, and MLA Styles
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <strong>
            <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/citation-guides.html">
             Citation Guides
            </a>
            (Muhlenberg College)
            <br />
           </strong>
           Examples of APA, Chicago, and MLA Styles
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <strong>
            Purdue Online Writing Lab (Purdue University)
           </strong>
           <br />
           <a href="https://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/section/2/10/">
            APA Style
           </a>
           <br />
           <a href="https://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/section/2/12/">
            Chicago Style
           </a>
           <br />
           <a href="https://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/747/01/">
            MLA Style
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Avoiding Plagiarism
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Indiana University's plagiarism tutorial also offers helpful information on understanding and recognizing plagiarism, including an
           <a href="https://www.indiana.edu/%7Eistd/overview.html">
            overview
           </a>
           with basics and recommendations and
           <a href="https://www.indiana.edu/%7Eistd/examples.html">
            examples
           </a>
           <b>
            .&nbsp;
            <br />
           </b>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt21771327" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile5769499" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox21771328">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="21771328">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title21771328">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Need Help with Your Research?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117745">
          <p>
           <em>
            Contact:
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <b>
            Jen Jarson
           </b>
           <br />
           Social Sciences Reference Librarian
           <br />
           phone: 484-664-3552
           <br />
           email: jarson@muhlenberg.edu
           <br />
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17117745" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
